senses.sense_definition: Simple past and past participle of <w>enumerate</w>.

examples.text: The professor <w>enumerated</w> the key causes of the war during the lecture.
She <w>enumerated</w> every item on the list to ensure nothing was missing.

senses.sense_definition: Explicitly listed or mentioned one by one, especially to establish a specific scope, limit, or set of rights.

examples.text: The federal government is limited to exercising its <w>enumerated</w> powers.
Please check if the goods are on the <w>enumerated</w> list of prohibited items.

senses.sense_definition: Defined to consist of a fixed, specified list of possible values or constants.

examples.text: Using <w>enumerated</w> types makes the code easier to read and maintain.
The variable must be assigned one of the <w>enumerated</w> constants defined in the header.

senses.sense_definition: Specified by a precise numeric count or value.

examples.text: The city has an <w>enumerated</w> population of over three million people.
They allocated an <w>enumerated</w> amount of funds for the relief effort.
